member.summary: Registers an action to configure the s used by tracing, metrics, and logging.
member.remarks: Note: This is safe to be called multiple times and by library authors. Each registered configuration action will be applied sequentially.

member.summary: Adds metric services into the builder.

Notes:
This is safe to be called multiple times and by library authors. Only a single will be created for a given .
This method automatically registers an named 'OpenTelemetry' into the .

member.name: T:OpenTelemetry.Internal.Guard
member.summary: Methods for guarding against exception throwing values.

member.summary: Throw an exception if the value is null.
member.param: The parameter name to use in the thrown exception.

member.summary: Throw an exception if the value is null or empty.
member.param: The parameter name to use in the thrown exception.

member.summary: Throw an exception if the value is null or whitespace.
member.param: The parameter name to use in the thrown exception.

member.summary: Throw an exception if the value is zero.

member.summary: Throw an exception if the value is not considered a valid timeout.

member.summary: Throw an exception if the value is not within the given range.
member.param: The parameter name to use in the thrown exception.
The name of the lower bound.
The name of the upper bound.
An optional custom message to use in the thrown exception.

member.summary: Throw an exception if the value is not of the expected type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.OpenTelemetryServicesExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for setting up OpenTelemetry services in an .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.OpenTelemetryServicesExtensions.AddOpenTelemetry(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary: Adds OpenTelemetry SDK services into the supplied .
member.remarks:
Notes:
This is safe to be called multiple times and by library authors. Only a single and/or will be created for a given .
OpenTelemetry SDK services are inserted at the beginning of the and started with the host. For details about the ordering of events and capturing telemetry in s see: .
